msItem.title: Isaiah, according to the Peshitta version
Isaiah, according to the Septuagint version
msItem.note: Exhibiting the Peshitta and Septuagint versions in parallel columns.
The remaining portions are: ch. 419—1.10, and lvii. 21—Iviii. 14, with the exception of some words which have been torn away.

layout.p: Each page is divided into two columns, of from 37 to 49 lines.

handNote.desc: Written in a good, regular hand of the9th century

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue . abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

msItem.title: Zechariah, according to the Peshitta version
msItem.note: One lesson is rubricated in the text, and another marked between the columns.

item.p: The folio is slightly torn.

layout.p: The pages are divided into two columns of 26 lines.

handNote.desc: The writing is a large Estrangela of the11th century.

msItem.title: Part of the Epistle ofEusebius of CaesareatoCarpianus

msItem.author: Eusebius of Caesarea
msItem.title: Fragments of the Eusebian Canons

item.p: They are both much mutilated.

handNote.desc: The writing is a fine regular Estrangela of thevith cent.

msItem.title: Fragments of a discourse, in the second of which Basil and Gregory Nazianzen are thus mentioned
msItem.quote: ܣܪܝܩܐܝܬ ܡ̇ܢ ܡܬܩܠܣ ܒܐܣܝܠܝܘܣ. ܣܪܝܩܐܝܬ ܕܝܢ ܐܦ ܓܪܝܓܘܪܝܘܣ. ܗ̇ܘ ܡ̇ܢ ܟܕ ܡ̇ܫܠܡ ܠܗ̇ ܠܗܝܡܢܘܬܐ ܒܗܠܝܢ ܕܡ̇ܡܠܠ. ܗ̇ܘ ܕܝܢ ܟܕ ܥܡܗ ܡܫܠܡ ܠܗ̇ ܒܗܠܝܢ ܕܡܬܕܢܐ ܠܗ. ܏ܘܫ.

item.p: Portions of two vellum leaves, both much soiled. Each page is divided into two columns.

handNote.desc: The writing is a good, regular Estrangělā, of the viiith or ixth cent.

msItem.author: Gregory Nyssen
msItem.title: Part of a discourse of Gregory Nyssen on S. Stephen the protomartyr
msItem.note: See Opera, t. iii., p. 354. The text begins, on fol. 8 a, with the passage corresponding to p. 355, l. 20, τὸ γὰρ ἑτοίμως τοῦτον καταλιπεῖν τὸν βίον, κ.τ.λ.; and ends with p. 362, l. 32, τοῖς δὲ ἀντικειμένοις φέρειν τὸν ὄλεθρον.

msItem.title: Part of a metrical discourse of Jacob of Batnae on the parable of the Vineyard, S. Matthew, ch. xxi. 38

item.p: Three vellum leaves, about 12 1/4 in. by 9 1/8, the first two of which are much stained and torn (Add. 17,213, foll. 8—10). Each page is divided into two columns, of from 43 to 45 lines.

handNote.desc: The writing is a neat, regular Estrangela of the viiith or ixth cent.

msItem.author: Jacob of Batnae
msItem.title: Part of the second discourse of Jacob of Batnae on the prophet Elijah, when he fled from Jezebel (1 Kings, ch. xix)
msItem.rubric: ܡܐܡܪܐ ܕܬܪ̈ܝܢ. ܕܥܠ ܐܠܝܐ̣. ܟܕ ܥ̣ܪܩ ܡܢ ܐܝܙܒܝܠ

msItem.title: Part of another (the fourth?) discourse on Elijah (1 Kings, ch. xxii.).

item.p: Two vellum leaves, about 11 7/8 in. by 9 1/8, the first of which is much stained and torn (Add. 17,213, foll. 11,12). Each page is divided into two columns, of from 35 to 37 lines.

handNote.desc: The writing is good and regular, of the ixth or xth cent.

item.p: On fol. 11a, there is a note stating that this manuscript belonged to the convent of S. Mary Deipara.

p.quote: [ܐܝܬܘܗ̱ܝ] ܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ ܕܕܝܪܐ ܕܒܝܬ ܝܠܕܬ ܐܠܗܐ ܕܡܕܒܪܐ ܕܐܣܩـ[ܝܛܝ]܀ ܟܠ ܕܫܐܠ ܠܗ ܕܢܩܪܐ ܒܗ ܘ܏ܫ.

msItem.title: Part of a metrical discourse of Jacob of Batnae on Pride
msItem.note: See Assemani, Bibl. Or., t. i., p. 316, no. 86.

item.p: A vellum leaf, 9 3/4 in. by 6 5/8, much torn. Each page is divided into two columns, of 34 or 35 lines.

handNote.desc: The writing is of the xth cent.

msItem.title: A list of the discourses of Jacob, that were contained in the manuscript of which this was the first leaf
The commencement of a metrical discourse of Jacob of Batnae on S. Simeon the aged
msItem.rubric: ܕܩܕ[ܝܫܐ] ܡܪܝ ܝܥܩـ[ـܘ]ܒ ܕܥܠ ܫܡܥܘܢ ܣܒܐ
msItem.note: See Assemani, Bibl. Or., t. i., p. 312, no. 37.

item.p: A vellum leaf, about 12 in. by 7 7/8, slightly torn. It is written in two columns, of 15 lines.

handNote.desc: The writing is a large Estrangela, of about the xith cent.

msItem.title: The conclusion of the discourse of Jacob of Batnae on S. Simeon the aged

item.p: A vellum leaf, 12 1/2 in. by 8, slightly torn. Each page is divided into 2 columns of 25 or 26 lines.

handNote.desc: The writing is a good, regular Estrangela of about the xith cent.

msItem.author: Jacob of Batnae
msItem.title: Portions of metrical discourses of Jacob of Batnae

item.p: Two vellum leaves, about 11 5/8 in. by 8, the second of which is much torn. Each page is divided into two columns, of from 26 to 28 lines. They once formed part of the last quire of a manuscript.

handNote.desc: The writing is good and regular, of the xth cent.

item.p: On the verso of the second leaf there is a note, stating that the manuscript to which they belonged was repaired at the expense of a monk named Thomas.

p.quote: ܢܗܘ̣ܘܢ ܪ̈ܚܡ̣ܐ ܕܐܠܗܐ ܒܬܪ̈ܝܗܘܢ ܥ̈ܠܡܐ. ܥܠ ܡܪܝ ܬܐܘܡܐ ܕܝܪܝܐ. ܘܢܚܣܐ ܠܗ ܘܠܥܢܝ̈ܕܘܗܝ. ܕܗ̣ܘ ܥܒ̣ܕ ܝܨܝܦܘܬܐ ܘܐܫܬܘܬܦ ܒܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ̣. ܘܫܡܠܝ ܚܣܝܪܘܬܗ. ܢܬܠ ܠܗ ܐܠܗܐ ܡܢܬܐ ܥܡ ܕܝܪ̈ܝܐ ܟܫܝܪ̈ܐ. ܘܠܟܠ ܕܐܫܬܘܬܦ.܀ ܘܥܠ ܫܦܠܐ ܘܕܘܝܐ ܘܚܛܝ ܡܢ ܟܠܢܫ ܕܣܪܛ. ܚܘܣ ܡܪܝܐ ܐܡܝܢ ܘܐܡܝܢ.

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue . abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

msItem.author: Jacob of Batnae
msItem.title: Part of a sūgīthā on S. Simeon the aged, probably composed by Jacob of Batnae
msItem.incipit: ܏ܣܘܓܝܬܐ ܏ܕܥܠ ܏ܫܥܡܘܢ ܏ܣܒܐ ܥܘܢܝܐ. ܒ܏ܪܝܟ ܏ܗ̣ܘ ܏ܡܫܝܚܐ ܏ܕܒܚܘܒܗ. ܏ܥܠ ܏ܕܪ̈ܥܘܗܝ ܏ܛܥ̣ܢܗ ܏ܗ̣ܘܐ ܏ܫܡܥܘܢ̇. ܒܬܘܠܬܐ ܢܟܦܬ ܢܟ̈ܦܬܐ. ܙܡܢܬܢܝ ܝܘܡܢ ܠܡܐܡܪܗ̇. ܬܘ ܥܘܠܘ ܐܬܒ̇ܣܡܘ ܥܝ̈ܠܝܡܘܗܝ ܕܓܢܘܢܐ. ܡܢ ܬܘܩ̈ܢܐ ܪ̈ܘܚܢܐ. ܕܠܙܡ̈ܝܢܐ ܥܒ̣ܕܬ ܒܬܘܠܬܐ܀

item.p: A vellum leaf, about 12 3/4 in. by 7 5/8, written in two columns, of 32 and 34 lines.

handNote.desc: It is written in a good, regular hand of the xth cent.

item.p: On the recto there is a note stating that the manuscript, of which this was the first leaf, was presented to the convent of S. Mary Deipara by Salībā or Abū 'Alī, of Bagdad , when Philotheus was patriarch of Alexandria (A.D. 981—1005) See Renaudot, Hist. Patr. Jacob. Alexandr., p. 373; Le Quien, Or. Christ, t. ii., col. 479. and Salībā of Arzan abbat of the convent.

p.quote: ܝ̇ܗܒ ܘܫܟܢ ܟܬܒܐ ܗ̇ܢܐ ܕܬܘܪ̈ܓܡܐ ܠܕܝܪܐ ܩ̇ܕܝܫܬܐ ܕܝܠܕܬ ܐܠܗܐ ܕܒܡܕܒܪܐ ܘܐܝܬܝܗ̇ ܕܣܘܪ̈ܝܝܐ. ܨܠ̣ܝܒܐ ܕܗ̣ܘ ܐܒܘܥܠܝ. ܡܢܚ ܢܦܫܐ. ܡ̣ܢ ܒܓܕܕ ܡ̣ܕܝܢܬܐ. ܒܝ̈ܘܡܝ ܡܪܝ ܦ݊ܝ݊ܠܐܬܝܣ ܦܛܪܝܪܐܟܝܣ (sic) ܕܟܘܪܣܝܐ ܫܠܝܚܝܐ ܕܡܪܩܘܣ. ܘܒܝ̈ܘܡܝ ܪܝܫ ܕܝܪܐ ܕܝܠܗ̇ ܕܕܘܟܬܐ ܨܠܝܒܐ. ܕܡܢ ܐܪܙܢ. ܘܠܝܬ ܫܘܠܛܢܐ ܠܐܢܫ ܡܢ ܐܠܗܐ ܕܢܦܩܗ̇ ܡܢ ܕܝܪܐ ܒܚܕ ܡܢ ܙܢ̈ܝܢ ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.title: Part of a life of Isaiah of Scete
msItem.incipit: ܛܘܒܢܐ ܗܟܝܠ ܐܒܐ ܐܫܥܝܐ̣. ܒܓܢܣܗ ܐܝܬܘܗܝ ܗܘܐ ܡܨܪܝܐ. ܏ܘܫ

item.p: A vellum leaf, about 12 5/8 in. by 7 5/8, much torn. There are 30 lines in the one page, and 32 in the other.

handNote.desc: It is written in a current hand of the xth or xith cent.

origin.origDate: of the xth or xith cent.

msItem.title: Greek canons for different occasions
msItem.note: It is the last leaf of a manuscript

item.p: Slightly stained

handNote.desc: Written in a good, regular hand

item.p: The manuscript was transcribed for the priestBar-saumāand the deaconIsaac, monks of theconvent of S. Mary Deipara.

p.quote: ܫܠ̣ܡ ܟܘܪܣܐ ܗܢܐ ܕܩܢ̈ܘܢܐ ܝܘ̈ܢܝܐ: ܫܢܬ ܐܠܦ. ܘܬ. ܘܝܒ. ܕܝܘ̈ܢܝܐ ܡܒܪ̈ܟܐ: ܟܬܒ̣ܢܢ ܗܢܐ ܟܘܪܣܐ ܘܗܠܝܢ ܟܘܪ̈ܣܐ ܐܚܪ̈ܢܐ. ܕܡܪܝ ܘܪܒܢ ܒܪܨܘܡܐ. ܕܝܪܝܐ ܩܫܝܫܐ ܢܟܦܐ. ܒܚܦܝܛܘܬܐ ܘܫܩܠܛܥܢܐ ܘܝܨܝܦܘܬܐ ܘܒܛܝ̣ܠܘܬܐ ܕܝܠܗ ܕܥܠ ܥܕܬܐ ܩܕܝܫܬܐ ܕܒܕܝܪܐ ܕܒܡܕܒܪܐ ܕܝ̇ܠܕܬ݀ ܐܠܗܐ ܕܡܕܒܪܐ ܕܐܣܩܛܝܣ. ܘܚܦܝܛܘܬܐ ܕܪܒܢ ܐܝܣܚܩ ܏ܡܫܡ ܕܝܪܝܐ ܢܟܦܐ. ܟܠ ܕܩ̇ܪܐ ܢܨ̇ܠܐ ܥܠܝܗܘܢ ܘܥܠ ܟܠ ܕܐܫܬܘܬܦܘ. ܘܠܐ ܐܬܥ̣ܕܠ ܡܢ ܚܘܒܟ ܪܒܢ ܩܪܘܝܐ ܡܝܩܪܐ ܡܛܠ ܟܬܝܒܬܐ ܘܓ̈ܠܛܐ ܘܦܘ̈ܕܐ ܡܛܠ ܕܠܐ ܐܝܬܝ ܟܬܘܒܐ. ܘܒܪܟܡܪܝ.

msItem.author: Cyril of Alexandria
msItem.title: Selections from the treatise of Cyril of Alexandria on Worship in Spirit and in Truth

msItem.title: Letters of Ammonius

msItem.title: A small portion of the fifth letter

msItem.title: The sixth letter
msItem.rubric: ܐܓܪܬܐ ܕܫܬ ܕܒܗ̇ ܡܚ̇ܦܛ ܡܛܠ ܥܪܘܩܝܐ ܕܡܢ ܥܠܡܐ̣. ܘܥܠ ܫܠܝܐ
msItem.incipit: ܠܚ̈ܒܝܒܝ ܕܒܡܪܢ̣ ܫܠܡ܀ ܝܕܥܝܢ ܐܢܬܘܢ ܕܡܢ ܕܗܘ̣ܐ ܥܒ̣ܪ ܦܘܩܕܢܐ̣. ܠܐ ܡܫܟܚܐ ܢܦܫܐ ܕܬܕܥ ܠܐܠܗܐ܇ ܏ܘܫ

msItem.author: Ephraim
msItem.title: Letter of Ephraim to the monks of the mountains
msItem.rubric: ܬܘܒ ܐܓܪܬܐ ܕܩܕܝܫܐ ܡܪܝ ܐܦܪܝܡ ܡܠܦܢܐ̣. ܕܠܘܬ ܛܘܪ̈ܝܐ ܘܐܒ̈ܝܠܐ
msItem.note: See Add. 14,623, no. 4 , and Overbeck, S. Ephraemi Syri etc. Opera Selecta, p. 113.

item.p: Nineteen vellum leaves, about 11 1/2 in. by 7 3/8, most of which are more or less stained and mutilated (Add. 17,213, foll. 21—39). Each page is divided into two columns, of from 53 to 56 lines.

handNote.desc: The writing is neat and regular, and seems to be of the ixth cent.

msItem.title: Title page of a lectionary

item.p: The leaf is much soiled and torn.

item.quote: ܥܠ ܣܒܪܐ ܕܬܠܝܬܝܘܬܐ ܩܕܝܫܬܐ܆ ܐܒܐ ܘܒܪܐ ܘܪܘܚܐ [ܕܩܘ] ܕܫܐ܆ ܡܫܪܝܢܢ ܠܡ̣ܟܬܒ . . . ܐ ܕܐܘܢܓܠܝܘܢ [ܩܕܝ]ܫܐ ܘܦܪܘܩܝܐ. ܕܕܠܐ . . . ܐ ܣܝ̣ܡ ܘܡܛܟ̣ܣ܇ . . . ܚܘܕܪܐ ܕܫ̇ܢܬܐ. ܏܏ܩܕܡ ܕܪܡܫ̣ܐ ܕܩܘܕܫܐ ܕܥܕܬܐ ܡܢ ܡܬܝ.

msItem.title: A note to the effect that the manuscript, to which it belonged, was presented, with several others, to the convent of S. Mary Deipara, by Zakhe Ya'kub, the oriental, and the recluse John, of the convent of Mar Matthew.
msItem.quote: ܗܕܐ ܦܢܩܝܬܐ ܥܡ ܟ̈ܬܒܐ ܐܚܪ̈ܢܐ ܫܲܟܢ ܠܗܘܢ ܙܟ̇ܐ ܝܥܩܘܒ ܡܕܢܚܝܐ. ܘܝܘܚܢܢ ܟܘܪܚܝܐ (؟) ܐܘܟܝܬ ܡܲܬܝܐ ܘܚܒܝܫܝܐ̣. ܠـ[ܕܝܪܐ] ܩܕܝܫܬܐ ܕܒܝܬ ܝܠ̣ܕܬ̇ ܐܠܗܐ ܡܪܬܝ ܡܪܝܡ ܐܝܟ ܕ[ܢܗܘܘܢ] ܠܗܘܢ ܥܠ̣ܬ ܥܘܗܕܢܐ ܠܟܠ ܦܪܘܫܐ ܕܢܩܪܐ [ܒܗ]ܘܢ ܘܢܐܡܪ ܕܐܠܗܐ ܚܲܣܐ ܘܫܒܘܩ ܚܘܒ̈ܝܗ[ܘܢ] ܕܗ̇ܢܘܢ ܕܫܲܟܢ ܠܗܘܢ ܠܕܘܟܬܐ ܗܕܐ ܩܕܝܫܬ[ܐ. ܘܠܐ] ܫܠܝܛ ܠܐܢܫ ܡܢ ܒܢ̈ܝܢܫܐ ܕܢܟܘܡ ܥܠܝܗܘܢ. ܏ܘܫ. ܘܫܟܢ ܥܡ ܗܠܝܢ ܟ̈ܬܒܐ ܬܘܒ ܟܬܒܐ ܕܦܪ . . . ܦܘܫܩܐ ܕܘܕ̈ܕܐ (sic) ܫܦܝܪܐ ܚ̣ܕܬܐ . . . ܡܢ ܥܘܡܪܐ ܛܒܝ̣ܒܐ ܕܡܪܝ ܡܬܝ ܢܨܝـ[ـܚܐ] ܘܟܬܒ̈ܐ ܐܚܪ̈ܢܐ ܕܝܕܥ̇ ܠܗܘܢ . . . ܟܠ ܕܢ̇ܛܪ ܠܗܘܢ ܐܠܗܐ ܢܢܛܪܝܘܗ[ܝ.] ܕܫ̇ܩܠ ܠܗܘܢ ܠܢܦܫܗ ܢܫܩܘܠ ܐ[ܒܕܢܐ] ܠܚܝ̈ܘܗܝ ܐܡܝܢ ܐܡܝܢ. ܗܘܝ ܗܠܝܢ [ܒܫܢܬ] ܐܠܦ ܘܚܡ̈ܫ ܡ̈ܐܐ ܘܥܣܪ̈ܝܢ ܕܝܘ̈[ܢܝܐ.] ܒܪܟܡܪ[ܝ].

item.p: A vellum leaf, 12 ½ in. in length, much torn, containing on the recto a note

item.p: Both leaves are much mutilated.

layout.p: There are from 28 to 35 lines in each page.

handNote.desc: The writing is partly Estrangela and partly cursive, of about the11th century.

msItem.title: Some short extracts relating to repentance
The contents of the volume to which it once belonged, and the following anathema:
msItem.quote: ܚܪܡܐ ܕܐܒܐ ܡܢ ܫܡܝܐ ܘܕܒܪܐ ܡܢ ܨܠܝܒܐ ܘܕܪܘܚܐ ܏ܩܕ ܡܢ ܝܘܪܕܢܢ ܢܗܪܐ. ܚܪܡܐ ܕ܏ܫ ܡܐܐ ܘܬܡܬܥܣܪ (sic) ܡܢ ܢܐܩܝܐܐ ܘܚܪܡܐ ܕܡܐܬܝܢ ܘܥܣܪܝܢ ܡܢ ܩܘܣܛܢܛܐܦܠܝܣ ܘܕܡܐܐ ܘܚܡܫܝܢ ܡܢ ܐܦܣܘܣ ܘܕܬܪܥܣܪ ܫ̈ܠܝܚܐ ܡܢ ܥܠܝܬܐ ܕܨܗܝܘܢ. ܒܢܦܫܗ ܘܒܦܓܪܗ ܘܕܥ̈ܢܝܕܘܗܝ ܘܕܟܠܡ̇ܢ ܕܡܫܬܘܬܦ ܒܗ. ܕܡܦܩ̇ ܠܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ ܡܢ ܗܕܐ ܕܝܪܐ ܘܠܐ ܡܕܥܪ ܠܗ ܠܟܐ ܐܝܢ ܘܐܡܝܢ.

item.p: A vellum leaf, about 12 in. by 8 7/8, slightly stained and torn.

handNote.desc: It is written in a hand of the xth cent.

msItem.title: Unspecified contents
msItem.note: What stands on the recto is much effaced.

msItem.title: Unspecified contents
msItem.quote: ܬܗܘܐ ܥܗܕ ܐܢܬ ܕܝܢܐ ܘܫܘܢܩܐ ܕܒܓܗܢܐ. ܘܡܨܐ ܗܢܐ ܪܢܝܐ ܪܕܦ ܡܢܟ [ܪ]ܒܘ ܒܝܫ̈ܬܐ. ܒܫܒܛܐ ܕܫܡܥܐ ܕܟܐܢܘܬܐ ܡܫܩܠ ܓܦܐ ܕܒܝ̈ܫܬܐ. ܠܡܘܬܐ ܡܡܬܘܡ ܠܐ ܬܛܥܐ ܘܠܐ ܡܟܐ ܠܟ ܫܘܒܗܪܐ. ܪܢܝܗ ܕܡܘܬܐ ܡܠܦ ܠܟ ܕܐܝܟ ܡܝܘܬܐ ܬܕܒܪ܀.

item.p: A vellum leaf, about 11 7/8 in. by 8 ¾ , much stained and slightly torn. It was one of the fly-leaves of a manuscript.

handNote.desc: On both sides are some lines of writing in a hand of the vith or viith cent.

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue , abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

interpretation.p: Description is based on Wright's Catalogue without consultation of physical manuscripts. Foliation is approximate. Wright often does not indicate ending folia so those have been assumed based on beginning folia.
Scribal notes which could not be more clearly classified based on Wright's descriptions have been identified as <addition>s whether they occur in the margins or the body of the manuscript.
In general, we have classified as an <msItem> as much of the manuscript contents as possible, including tables of contents and indices.

category.category: Catenae Patrum and Demonstrations against Heresies
Councils of the Church and Ecclesioastical Canons
